main event: A sighting of a silvery object brighter than the sun occurred in Springfield, Ohio on June 4, 1960.
interesting points: The object appeared as a light and was observed to be stationary., The sighting lasted between 6 to 9 minutes., The observer estimated the distance of the object to be about 2-3 miles away., Possible explanations included a balloon or aircraft due to unusual atmospheric conditions., The weather at the time included scattered clouds.
witness description: A civilian observer with an age of 32.
